718650f-a.text:
Charlton Street, south side, west from Hudson to Greenwich Streets. In the foreground are several frame buildings (S. W. corner of Hudson Street) which are absent in 1922 and their site vacant according to Bromleys New York Atlas of that year. Note the cobblestones and the horse car rails.
1898
J. Corell
P. L. Sperr
718650f-a.folder: Charlton Street & Hudson Street, Manhattan, NY

718649f-a.text:
Charlton Street, north side, clearing west of Hudson Street, looking across the future site of the Standard Statistics Building to the houses on the north side of King Street.
April 23, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
718649f-a.folder: Charlton Street & Hudson Street, Manhattan, NY

720523f-a.text:
Hudson Street at Charlton Street, seen from the cleared N.W. corner, in the foreground, the block where the Standard Statistics Building will rise.
April 23, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
720523f-a.folder: Hudson Street & Charlton Street, Manhattan, NY

720527f-a.text:
Hudson Street, west side, from Charlton Street to King, showing the excavation for the new Standard Statistics Building.
April 23,1930.
P. L. Sperr.
720527f-a.folder: Hudson Street & Charlton Street, Manhattan, NY

720528f-a.text:
Evening Graphic Building, Hudson Street, east side, from Charlton to King Streets, seen across the clearing on the west side where the Standard Statistics Building will rise.

April 23, 1930

P. L. Sperr
720528f-a.folder: Hudson Street & Charlton Street, Manhattan, NY

720530f-a.text:
1) Excavation work on the site of the new Standard Statistics Building, 345 Hudson Street, west side, between Charlton and King Streets, view northwest.  The water is probably seepage from the underground channel of Kinetta Creek, which emptied into the North River about a block further west of here.  This spot is about on the southern edge of the swampy little island, later known as Burr's Pond, near the mouth of the creek.

April 23, 1930

P. L. Sperr

2) A moment later, as the steam shovel empties its load into the truck.

Other pictures taken simultaneously with these two are the views of 93 to 113 King Street and 99 to 125 King Street, both of which include this steam shovel in the foreground, also 102 to 112 Charlton Street, east of and including the S.E. corner of Greenwich Street.

April 23, 1930

P. L. Sperr.
720530f-a.folder: Hudson Street & Charlton Street, Manhattan, NY

This spot is about on the southern edge of the swampy little island, later known as Burr's Pond, near the mouth of the creek.

718646f-a.text:
(1)
71 to 69 Charlton Street, north side, between Hudson and Varick Streets. The No. 69 half of the building is frame behind its brick facing.
1912.
(2)
The same, a winter view. About 1926 these houses will be torn down for the building of a garage.
About 1912.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
718646f-a.folder: Charlton Street & Hudson Street, Manhattan, NY

718647f-a.text:
(1) 71 to 69 Charlton Street, north side, between Hudson and Varick Streets. The No. 69 half of the building is frame behind its brick facing.

1912.

(2) The same, a winter view.  About 1926 these houses will be torn down for the building of a garage.

About 1912.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
718647f-a.folder: Charlton Street & Hudson Street, Manhattan, NY

718648f.text:
Charlton Street, east from a point midway between Hudson and Varick Streets, across the latter to Sixth Ave. Extension.  The north sidewalk appears in the foreground.

March 23, 1933.

Irvin Fitterman.
718648f.folder: Charlton Street & Hudson Street, Manhattan, NY
